description: Unique identifier for the preventive maintenance schedule record.
System date-time of the most recent update to this record.
Indicates whether an overdue notification email has already been sent.
Indicates whether a due-soon notification email has already been sent.
Calculated date when the next preventive service becomes due.
Date when the associated maintenance was last completed.
Count of schedule trigger events processed for this record; exact basis may vary by configuration; confirm with SME.
Secondary counter of trigger events (e.g., alternate meter or pattern); confirm intended use with SME.
Remaining usage units until the next service threshold is reached; negative indicates overdue by that amount.
Remaining days before the next service is due; negative indicates overdue.
Fuel reading captured at the last completed service, for fuel-based scheduling.
Secondary meter reading recorded at the last completed service; sentinel values indicate unused.
Primary meter reading recorded at the last completed service.
Secondary pattern’s accumulated meter value at the last pattern checkpoint; likely used for pattern-based intervals; confirm with SME.
Primary pattern’s accumulated meter value at the last pattern checkpoint; likely used for pattern-based intervals; confirm with SME.
Serialized configuration (XML) defining triggers, intervals, and rules for this maintenance schedule.
Identifier of the currently open work order generated from this schedule, if any.
Display/lookup reference for the current work order identifier; used for UI rendering; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the most recently generated or linked work order for this schedule.
Display/lookup reference for the linked work order; used for UI or joins; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the equipment set associated to this schedule (grouping of assets).
Display/lookup reference for the associated equipment set; used for UI; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the preventive maintenance set or template applied to this schedule.
Display/lookup reference for the PM set or template; used for UI; confirm with SME.
Optional subtask or category code (D level) linked to this schedule; confirm taxonomy with SME.
Display/lookup reference for the D-level subtask/category; used for UI; confirm with SME.
Optional subtask or category code (C level) linked to this schedule; confirm taxonomy with SME.
Display/lookup reference for the C-level subtask/category; used for UI; confirm with SME.
Optional subtask or category code (B level) linked to this schedule; confirm taxonomy with SME.
Display/lookup reference for the B-level subtask/category; used for UI; confirm with SME.
Optional subtask or category code (A level) linked to this schedule; confirm taxonomy with SME.
Display/lookup reference for the A-level subtask/category; used for UI; confirm with SME.
Primary task or work code that characterizes the maintenance activity.
Display/lookup reference for the primary task or work code (e.g., category name).
Identifier of the asset/equipment to which this schedule applies.
Display/lookup reference for the associated asset/equipment.
Unit type for the primary meter (e.g., miles, hours, kilometers).
Original identifier from the source legacy system, for cross-system traceability.
Name of the source legacy table from which this record originated.
Selected configuration option set used by the schedule builder (e.g., PM template rules).
Free-text description of the schedule or maintenance activity.
Value used with the shortcut scheduling feature (e.g., quick-set interval or quantity); confirm exact semantics with SME.
Look-ahead window (in days) for pre-creating upcoming work orders.
Interval count for time-based scheduling, used with the associated time unit.
Fuel consumption threshold used to trigger service; sentinel values indicate disabled.
Fourth meter-based interval threshold for triggering service; sentinel values indicate unused.
Third meter-based interval threshold for triggering service; sentinel values indicate unused.
Second meter-based interval threshold for triggering service; sentinel values indicate unused.
Primary meter-based interval threshold for triggering service.
Fourth meter’s reading recorded at the last completed service; sentinel values indicate unused.
Third meter’s reading recorded at the last completed service; sentinel values indicate unused.
Indicates whether the schedule repeats automatically after completion.
When true, seasonal restrictions are ignored and scheduling proceeds year-round.
Indicates that the system-calculated target date was manually overridden.
Flags the record as a preventive maintenance schedule.
Explicit date used as a starting point or anchor for the schedule builder.
Calendar date assigned for executing the next maintenance occurrence.
Identifier for the most recently applied service pattern instance.
Display/lookup reference for the last applied service pattern instance.
Code indicating how this record was created (e.g., UI, import, integration); confirm code set with SME.
Display/lookup reference for the creation source code; used for UI; confirm with SME.
Type of input used by the shortcut scheduling feature (e.g., meter, time).
Unit of measure for the time-based interval (e.g., days, months).
Which basis the schedule uses (e.g., meter-based, time-based, or combined).
Reference to the template defining the sequence of services for this schedule.
Display/lookup reference for the service pattern template.
Estimated days remaining until the meter reaches the due threshold, based on usage trends.
Meter value at which the next maintenance should occur.
Predicted calendar date when the meter is expected to reach the due threshold.
Date used by the time-based component (e.g., last or next time trigger); exact meaning may vary; confirm with SME.
Date when the meter-based threshold was exceeded, making the service overdue.
